intro: Agathosma dummeri, commonly known as Dummer’s buchu, is a small, aromatic shrub native to South Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal and mountainous regions. It is closely related to other members of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants. Its essential oils, derived from the leaves, are used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent.
